title.narrative: Support to children with special needs in social inclusion through education. 'Let's make a move'

description.narrative: Project activities include the organizing the cooperative educational workshops in 8 towns in Serbia education of peers and the public in support of children with special needs education by short educational films promotion of project activities and projec t concept and organizing of the final Conference. The cooperative educational workshops will bring together parents and teachers with the aim of stronger intersectoral cooperation their interconnection and education. Education of peers and the public in the support of children with special needs will be achieved through the activities of collection of stories of a blind little girl ?My Blue Star? catalogue of art work of talented children with special needs an exhibition of works of childre n with special needs promotion of achievements and obstacles the disabled are facing in the society. Several short educational documentaries will be filmed which deal with various aspects of the life of a disabled person. Public promotion will be carried out throughout the duration of the project and all activities in order to have more successful realization of project goals dissolve prejudices and promote human rights and necessary inclusion of children with special needs. The promotion will be carried out by TV and newspaper articles promo posters and brochures stickers T-shirts and other promotional materials. The final conference on the role and importance of team work of parents teachers and key factors in inclusion with the presentation of all results of former campaigns and projects will present sustainable system of cooperation on the line parent ? teacher ? child with special needs. The target groups are teachers at pre-school institutions parents of which with special needs at pre-sc hool institutionschildren with special needschildren from the mass population while the final beneficiaries are children of pre-school age families and persons and children with special needs.
